description: Just like Goddess Kushmanda, who offers strength and warmth to the universe, the hue orange raises energy and passion, boosting the festive mood to new heights. So, let's have a look at some ideas for letting the orange glow light up your Navratri celebration, from eye-catching décor to tangy bhog offerings and colourful clothing, we have covered everything.

title: Signs of a heart attack in young people
description: Heart attacks among young individuals, especially aged 18-44, are rising alarmingly, even in those leading seemingly healthy lifestyles. Experts highlight that being sedentary, poor diets, and stress are key factors. Early signs include neck and shoulder pain, unusual sweating, and shooting arm pains. Awareness and timely medical consultation can help mitigate risks.

Here, we have got you a unique optical illusion personality test, that, as per yourtango.com reveals your greatest strengths and weaknesses- - based on the first thing that you see in the given picture. description: The 19th-century Hindu monk Swami Vivekananda inspires people worldwide with his timeless words of wisdom even today. Here we list some of his profound quotes that can transform your life too.

title: Navratri Day 4: How to style brown
description: Navratri's fourth day honours Goddess Kushmanda Mata, symbolizing creation, vitality, and prosperity. Devotees often dress in brown, reflecting earthiness and stability. Styling tips include pairing brown with gold accents, vibrant shades, subtle prints, and traditional accessories. Comfortable footwear is essential for the festival's dancing and celebrations. Embrace brown to connect with the divine and festive spirit.

description: Nita Ambani dazzled at Manish Malhotra's store launch in Mumbai, wearing a neon green sari that blended traditional elegance with modern boldness. Her understated yet glamorous sari, luxurious accessories, and meticulous styling highlighted her impeccable taste in fashion, proving that simplicity can be powerful and timeless.

description: Not all signs of intelligence are as obvious as high grades or academic achievements. By recognizing these less common but significant traits, parents can better support and nurture their child's development.

description: Let's take a look at best Navratri hairstyles inspired by Bollywood beauties.

description: This includes Dominguez Blanco’s remarkable shot of a nuthatch climbing down an oak tree, along with stunning images from other winners, including the unique shot by overall winner Patricia Homonylo.

title: 8 simple and tasty potato snacks for Navratri
description: During festivals like Navratri, devotees observing fasts enjoy versatile potato-based snacks. Eight popular options include sabudana vada, aloo tikki, stuffed aloo, aloo chaat, homemade potato chips, aloo bonda, mashed potato balls, and aloo paneer skewers. These snacks are flavorful, filling, and adherent to fasting guidelines.

description: Although there are a number of questions about this subject of interest that still need to be answered, scientists have successfully made progress in classifying them. Let’s explore these classifications in detail, gaining a better understanding of them!

description: Let's take a look at some lehenga ideas to borrow from Bollywood actresses.

title: Only super intelligent can spot a bird in under 12 seconds
description: A challenging optical illusion featuring a hidden baby chick among sheep tests visual acuity and intelligence. Only the keenest eyes can spot the chick in 12 seconds. Beyond entertainment, such illusions improve problem-solving skills, creativity, focus, memory retention, and offer relaxation. The hidden chick blends with the sheep's wool, adding to the difficulty.

title: Inspiration for kids: The story of Pinki Haryan
description: Pinki Haryan's journey from begging on the streets to becoming a physician exemplifies the transformative power of education and support. Her story underscores the importance of parental encouragement in helping children overcome challenges and achieve their dreams, no matter how lofty.

title: Nita and Isha Ambani dazzle together
description: The opening night of the "Wildlife Photographer of the Year" exhibition at Nita Mukesh Ambani Cultural Centre saw Mukesh Ambani, Nita Ambani, Isha Ambani, and Anand Piramal in attendance. The event, marked by elegant fashion choices from Nita and Isha, celebrated the first hosting of the exhibit by NMACC, attracting several high-profile guests.

title: Men of this village dress as women during Navratri
description: Every year during the Navratri, a unique custom takes place in Sadu Mata Ni Pol, a locality in Ahmedabad. On the eighth night of the festival, men from the Barot community put on sarees and perform Garba- - a ceremonial dance. This astonishing tradition has been in practice for over 200 years and is deep-seated in a heart-wrenching story.

title: Sustained rise in antimicrobial resistance in India: ICMR study
description: A study by ICMR revealed that Klebsiella pneumoniae and Acinetobacter baumannii showed resistance to imipenem among ICU patients with bloodstream infections. Staphylococcus aureus and Enterococcus faecium were resistant to oxacillin and vancomycin, respectively. A high resistance rate was also noted in bacteria causing UTIs and pneumonia.

title: What lifestyle changes can help you stay cancer-free?
description: By adopting a healthier lifestyle and being proactive about your health, you can make a meaningful impact on your overall well-being.

title: ICMR to study efficacy of Metformin, Inositol in PCOS treatment
description: India's ICMR will study the efficacy of Metformin and Inositol drugs in improving fertility and birth outcomes in PCOS women. Despite widespread use, evidence on their effectiveness is limited, especially in the Indian context. The multi-centre study will address this knowledge gap.

title: Detox dangers: Why you should reconsider
description: Detoxes lack scientific backing and may be unsafe due to poor regulation. Experts recommend consulting a healthcare professional for personalized, sustainable health solutions instead of relying on detox products.

title: Govt may mandate QR codes to check fake cancer drugs
description: The Indian government plans to require QR codes on all cancer drugs. This step aims to prevent counterfeit medicines and ensure drug authenticity. The Drugs Technical Advisory Board has agreed to the proposal. An amendment to the Drugs Rules, 1945, is necessary before implementation. This move follows earlier efforts to add barcodes on top 300 drug brands.

title: Lupin subsidiary acquires 9 brands South African firm
description: Lupin's subsidiary, in partnership with ImpiloVest, has acquired nine brands from MNI in South Africa, enhancing its portfolio in complementary and alternative medicines. The acquired brands address various health issues, aligning with Lupin's commitment to holistic and sustainable healthcare solutions.

title: Quick access to key HIV drug hinges on waiver of local clinical trials: Experts
description: Faster access to HIV drug lenacapavir in India hinges on the waiver of local clinical trials. Six companies, including three from India, have non-exclusive, royalty-free licenses to produce generic versions. They must apply for waivers to supply the drug locally and in 120 low- and middle-income countries. Approval from the drug regulator is crucial.

title: Emcure Pharmaceuticals partners with Gilead Sciences to produce HIV prevention drug Lenacapavir
description: Emcure Pharmaceuticals has partnered with Gilead Sciences Ireland UC to manufacture and distribute generic lenacapavir for HIV prevention and treatment. This royalty-free agreement focuses on increasing access to the drug in 120 countries, especially resource-limited nations. Emcure aims to provide high-quality, low-cost HIV medication to improve health outcomes globally.

title: CCI clears Rs 13,630 cr Mankind Pharma acquisition of Bharat Serums
description: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has approved Mankind Pharma's ₹13,630-crore acquisition of Bharat Serums and Vaccines. This acquisition will strengthen Mankind's position in the Indian women's health and fertility drug market. Mankind Pharma and Bharat Serums both specialize in pharmaceutical formulations and healthcare products.

title: Dr Reddy's enters voluntary licensing deal with Gilead for long-acting HIV drug
description: Dr. Reddy’s has partnered with Gilead Sciences to manufacture and market the HIV drug Lenacapavir in India and 120 other countries. The agreement includes developing Lenacapavir for both treatment and potential prevention of HIV. This collaboration aims to make this advanced treatment accessible in regions with high HIV burdens.

title: What are enzymes? Discover their importance in digestion
description: Enzymes are proteins that act as catalysts, accelerating biochemical reactions by breaking down larger molecules into smaller ones. They are essential for various bodily functions, including detoxification, energy conversion, and cellular growth.

title: CK Birla Healthcare eyes $150 million fundraise via stake sale
description: CK Birla Healthcare, part of the CK Birla Group, aims to raise around $150 million by selling a minority stake. Funds will be used for expansion and debt reduction. The healthcare arm, featuring multiple hospitals and IVF centers, recorded a 34% revenue growth in FY24.

title: CCI clears Rs 13,630-cr Mankind Pharma-Bharat Serums Vaccines deal
description: The Competition Commission of India has approved Mankind Pharma's Rs 13,630 crore acquisition of Bharat Serums and Vaccines. This acquisition, which includes a 100% stake, advances Mankind Pharma's position in the women's health and fertility drug market and grants access to critical care products with established R&D platforms.

title: Government looking to tweak regulatory norms for MedTech, pharma sectors: Niti Aayog's VK Paul
description: The Indian government is considering regulatory revisions for the MedTech and pharma sectors and has sought input from the industry. Niti Aayog member VK Paul highlighted the need to update the regulatory framework to support advancements in medical technology and pharma, aiming for enhanced exports and innovation.

title: Sun Pharma, Philogen enter exclusive licensing pact for commercialisation of specialty cancer drug Firbomun
description: Sun Pharma has signed a global licensing deal with Philogen to commercialize Fibromun, an anti-cancer treatment currently in trial for soft tissue sarcoma and glioblastoma. Philogen will complete clinical trials and seek marketing authorization, while Sun Pharma will handle commercialization. Post-commercialization profits will be shared between both companies.

title: Dr Lal PathLabs sets sights on big buys to expand in south
description: "In south, we are open to looking at M&A opportunities, we did (acquisition of) Suburban (Diagnostics in the Western region). It was our first large sized M&A, so we took about two years to figure out the whole integration process, how do we want to run it, lot of management bandwidth went into stabilising and putting into the growth path, right now the management bandwidth is available, cash on the books are available," said Shankha Banerjee, CEO of Dr Lal.

title: Hospitals queue up for NABH's digital accreditation
description: NABH announced that approximately 100 hospitals in India have received digital health accreditation, indicating strong participation in the initiative. This program, featuring multi-level maturity assessments, aims to standardize healthcare processes, improve patient outcomes, and enhance overall efficiency through advanced technology integration.

title: Lupin ties up with Scope Opthalmics to market eyecare products in Mexico
description: Drug maker Lupin has signed a distribution agreement with Ireland-based Scope Ophthalmics to market the Optase range of eye care products in Mexico, aimed at treating conditions like dry eyes, blepharitis, and meibomian gland dysfunction. This deal enhances Lupin’s ophthalmology portfolio while expanding Scope’s presence in Latin America, emphasizing their commitment to improving vision care.

title: Struggling with high Uric Acid? Try these 8 homemade drinks
description: Here are 8 homemade drinks that can naturally help reduce uric acid levels:

title: Dr Reddy's completes acquisition of Haleon's NRT portfolio
description: Dr Reddy's Laboratories has acquired Haleon's global Nicotine Replacement Therapy (NRT) portfolio, excluding the US, for GBP 458 million. This includes top brands like Nicotinell, Nicabate, Thrive, and Habitrol, spanning over 30 countries. The acquisition strengthens Dr Reddy's consumer healthcare segment.

title: Life support withdrawal for terminally ill: IMA flags concerns, says it will put doctors under stress
description: The Indian Medical Association has expressed concerns over new guidelines that put the responsibility of deciding on life support withdrawal on doctors. The draft suggests a dual-board system and family consent for terminally ill patients. This aims to help families make informed choices but may stress doctors.

title: Venus Remedies get market authorisations for two cancer drugs from Morocco, Philippines
description: Venus Remedies Ltd has received marketing authorisations for two key oncology drugs, carboplatin and bortezomib, from Morocco and the Philippines. These approvals are part of the company's strategy to expand its oncology range and meet the growing global demand for cancer treatments, strengthening its position in Southeast Asia and Africa.

title: Linking spurious drugs with legitimate manufacturers has severe reputational, financial impact: IPA
description: The Indian Pharmaceutical Alliance (IPA) has called for a clear distinction between spurious and sub-standard drugs following a CDSCO report listing over 50 products as 'not of standard quality'. Major drug firms like Sun Pharma and Glenmark assert that flagged medicines are counterfeits, not their products. IPA emphasizes the need to protect India's reputation as a reliable medicine supplier.

title: Pharmacology experts promote rational drug use at Kashmir conference
description: Government Medical College in Anantnag hosted a conference of the Indian Society for Rational Pharmacotherapeutics, focusing on advancements in pharmacology and rational drug use. The event aimed to foster collaboration among professionals and improve healthcare outcomes. Notable attendees included Neelofar Khan, Vice Chancellor of University of Kashmir, and other prominent medical experts.

title: Regulatory, policy reforms crucial for future of India's pharma R&D: Report
description: India's regulatory and policy reforms are crucial for the future of pharmaceutical R&D, streamlining approval processes and strengthening IP protections. Despite significant transformation, challenges like inadequate drug regulation capacity and high compliance costs hinder growth. The report suggests promoting India as a hub for pharmaceutical research and development.

title: 1 in every 4 diabetics at serious risk of heart failure: Study
description: Studies in Mumbai and Delhi-NCR reveal that one in four diabetic patients are at serious risk of developing heart failure. Elevated NT-proBNP levels, a key biomarker for early heart failure detection, were found in 15% of patients with high HbA1c scores. Experts emphasize the need for cardiovascular screening in routine diabetes care.

title: Health ministry comes up with new draft guidelines on passive euthanasia
description: The Union Health Ministry's draft guidelines on passive euthanasia suggest doctors should make considered decisions on withdrawing life support for terminally ill patients based on specific conditions. The guidelines aim to ensure decisions are in the patient's best interests, considering factors like brainstem death and informed refusal by the patient or their kin.

title: Monkeypox in India: Key do's and don'ts you need to follow
description: The Health Ministry's guidelines for Monkeypox in India stress isolation, testing, and public awareness while urging prompt reporting of cases.

title: Medical bills in India are rapidly becoming bigger, reveals new index
description: ACKO India Health Insurance Index 2024 reveals a 14% annual rise in healthcare costs, with 62% of expenses paid out of pocket. Delhi leads in kidney disease claims, while Kolkata and Mumbai see high heart disease claims. It emphasised the need for improved health coverage to protect individuals from unexpected health crises.

title: EQT to exit AGS Health, eyes $750 million valuation
description: Swedish fund EQT Partners is set to sell its five-year-old investment in US-based healthcare IT services firm AGS Health, aiming for a valuation of $750 million-$780 million. The sale process, managed by JP Morgan and Bank of America, will launch early next year. AGS Health provides revenue cycle management solutions and employs 12,000 people across multiple locations.

title: Lupin inks pact with Celnova Pharma for distribution of drug in 2 South American nations
description: Lupin's subsidiary has signed a pact with Celnova Pharma to distribute NaMuscla in Argentina and Colombia. The drug treats non-dystrophic myotonic disorders, improving quality of life for patients. Celnova will handle registration, importation, storage, and sales, while Lupin will manufacture and supply the product.

title: Alembic Pharma gets USFDA nod for generic drug used to treat schizophrenia
description: Alembic Pharmaceuticals has received final approval from the USFDA for its generic version of Paliperidone extended-release tablets, used to treat schizophrenia and schizoaffective disorder. The approval covers strengths of 1.5 mg, 3 mg, 6 mg, and 9 mg. The market size for these tablets is estimated at USD 48 million for the year ending June 2024.

title: Alkem Labs denies claims of Pan-D, Clavam 625 batches being not-of-standard quality
description: Alkem Laboratories has denied claims that its products Pan-D and Clavam 625 are of substandard quality. The company stated that an investigation revealed the samples flagged by the central drug regulatory authority were spurious and not manufactured by Alkem. Unique features and QR codes have been added to the packaging to distinguish genuine products.

title: Want to make India a reliable pharmacy of world, says Secretary Department of Pharmaceuticals
description: The Indian pharmaceutical industry is emerging as a crucial part of the economy, driven by the success of the Make in India initiative and the Production-Linked Incentive scheme. The sector has seen significant growth in exports and global interest, with many Contract Research, Development, and Manufacturing Organisations establishing operations in India.

title: Sequent Scientific, Viyash Life Sciences announce Rs 8,000 crore merger
description: Sequent Scientific and Viyash Life Sciences have announced a merger, creating a platform with leadership in animal pharmaceuticals and integrated capabilities across the global pharmaceutical market. The merger will expand Sequent's capital base and is expected to enhance marketing presence, facilitate backward integration, and create procurement synergies.

title: Carlyle Group portfolio companies in advanced talks for a potential merger
description: Sequent Scientific, which is in animal health business, posted revenue of around Rs 1,400 crore in FY24. It had earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation of Rs 100 crore. It has seven manufacturing sites in India, Spain, Brazil and Turkey. Viyash was founded in February 2019 by Hari Babu, formerly the chief operating officer of the world's largest generic drug maker, Mylan, now known as Viatris. Viyash posted FY24 revenue of Rs 1,400 crore with ebitda at Rs 150 crore.

title: Suspended eye drops not intended to replace glasses, says Entod CEO
description: Mumbai-based Entod Pharmaceuticals clarified that its eye drop PresVu is not intended to replace reading glasses for presbyopia. This follows the Indian drug regulator's suspension of its manufacture and sale due to unapproved claims. The company's CEO acknowledged the regulator's decision, stating the eye drop is a therapeutic option.

title: Biocon inks licensing, supply pact with Tabuk Pharmaceutical Manufacturing Co
description: Biocon Ltd has signed a licensing and supply agreement with Tabuk Pharmaceutical Manufacturing Company to commercialise its GLP-1 products for diabetes and chronic weight management in select Middle Eastern countries. Tabuk Pharmaceuticals will handle marketing, registration, import, and promotion. The agreement includes potential expansion to other GLP products and localised manufacturing.

title: Did not manufacture drugs flagged in CDSCO report, say leading pharma companies
description: Drug companies like Sun Pharma and Torrent Pharma have refuted claims in a CDSCO report that flagged certain medicines as "counterfeits". They assert their products meet quality standards and are implementing measures like QR codes to ensure authenticity. The CDSCO listed over 50 drugs as "not of standard quality" in its latest report.

title: Torrent Pharma refutes claims product Shelcal 500, failed quality test by CDSCO
description: Torrent Pharmaceuticals has denied claims that its popular product Shelcal 500 failed a quality test by the Central Drug Standards Control Organisation (CDSCO). The company asserts that the sample tested was counterfeit and not manufactured by them. Torrent has implemented QR codes to verify authenticity and submitted a formal response to CDSCO.

title: Krsnaa Diagnostics picks up stake in PPP hospital operator Apulki Healthcare
description: Krsnaa Diagnostics has acquired a 23.53% stake in Apulki Healthcare, which operates cancer and cardiac care hospitals under a public-private partnership model. This strategic move will make Krsnaa the exclusive diagnostics partner for Apulki's hospitals for over 30 years, starting with two advanced facilities in Pune and Mumbai.

title: Intuitive Surgical opens GCC in Bengaluru, to hire 250 people
description: Intuitive Surgical has opened a Global Capability Centre in Bengaluru, employing up to 250 full-time positions across various functions. The centre will support the product lifecycle, including upgrades and customer service. The company's da Vinci robotic surgical system is experiencing growth in India, driven by rising demand for robotic-assisted surgeries.

title: Sequent Scientific, Viyash Life Sciences explore merger worth Rs 7000-8000 cr
description: Sequent Scientific and Viyash Life Sciences are discussing a potential merger valued at Rs. 7000-8000 crore. Both companies' boards will meet to consider the deal, which could offer back-end synergies. Carlyle, a global private equity firm, holds shares in both firms. The merger aims to leverage Viyash's manufacturing capacity for Sequent's benefit.

title: 50 new plants to come up in 2 yrs under pharma, medical device PLI scheme: Official
description: The Indian government plans to establish 50 new greenfield pharma and medical device plants under the PLI scheme within two years. This follows the success of the 'Make in India' initiative, which has already seen 50 such plants become operational, significantly boosting exports and achieving trade balance in bulk drugs.

title: Paracetamol to pantop: CDSCO finds over 50 sub-standard drugs. Check full list of medicines
description: The Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO) has flagged over 50 drugs, including Paracetamol, as 'not of standard quality'. The report highlights concerns with various medications such as calcium and vitamin D3 supplements, anti-diabetes pills, and high blood pressure medicines. Some pharmaceutical companies have denied responsibility, claiming the drugs are spurious.

title: OneSource in talks to raise Rs 1,670 crore in pre-listing round
description: OneSource, a TPG Growth-backed specialty pharma CDMO, is in talks with investors to raise $200 million. The company, formerly Stelis Biopharma, was demerged from Strides Pharma and aims to list on BSE and NSE within a year. OneSource plans to reduce debt and expand its manufacturing capabilities.

title: IHH Health eyes acquisitions to grow business: CEO Prem Kumar Nair
description: IHH Healthcare plans to double its bed capacity in India to 10,000 beds over the next 4-5 years through brownfield expansion and acquisitions. The group aims to be among the top three healthcare providers in India, expanding into tier-2 cities while maintaining dual brands Fortis and Gleneagles.

title: Piramal Pharma targets to double revenue in 5 years
description: Piramal Pharma aims to achieve $2 billion in annual revenue with a 25% operating margin by fiscal 2030, driven by its CDMO business. The company plans strategic investments to enhance capabilities in various segments and is also focusing on reducing debt. Currently, CDMO contributes significantly to its revenue.

title: Health expenditure share against GDP increases from 1.13% in FY15 to 1.84% in FY22
description: The government health expenditure in India has increased from 1.13% of GDP in 2014-15 to 1.84% in 2021-22, according to the National Health Account estimates. Government spending on healthcare has tripled, while out-of-pocket expenses have significantly decreased, reflecting positive progress towards financial protection and Universal Health Coverage.

title: Testing of drugs from some nations eased
description: The government has decided to reduce the frequency of testing for drugs imported from certain countries, provided their samples have not failed quality tests in the past five years. Random sampling will be conducted periodically, and any failed samples will lead to increased testing. New sources must undergo compulsory testing.

title: As Bird Flu Spreads, Two New Cases Diagnosed in California
description: Both patients were dairy workers whose illnesses were mild. Investigators are continuing to evaluate the contacts of a Missouri patient who had no exposure to animals.

title: What to Know About Test Alternatives to Colonoscopies for Colon Cancer Screening
description: Doctors can provide alternative forms of screening for colon and rectal cancer but sometimes have a good reason to stick with the colonoscope.

title: Trump Promised to Release His Medical Records. He Still Won’t Do It.
description: If elected again, he would become the oldest president by the end of his term. Yet he is refusing to disclose even basic health information.

title: Gilead Agrees to Allow Generic Version of Groundbreaking H.I.V. Shot in Poor Countries
description: Many middle-income countries are left out of the deal, widening a gulf in access to critical medicines.

title: As America’s Marijuana Use Grows, So Do the Risks
description: The drug, legal in much of the country, is widely seen as nonaddictive and safe. For some users, these assumptions are dangerously wrong.

title: Stories of Marijuana’s Little-Known Harms: ‘It Took Over Everything’
description: A growing number of marijuana users in the U.S. are experiencing severe health problems like these.

title: What to Know About the Marburg Virus Disease Outbreak
description: In Rwanda, 11 deaths have been reported from this rare but deadly disease. Two people tested negative in Germany this week.

title: Officials Cast Doubt on a Dementia Drug, but Human Trials Continue
description: The S.E.C. alleged shortcomings in research said to support the drug, and its developer agreed to a $40 million settlement. Some experts wonder why clinical trials have not been stopped.

title: Breast Cancer Continues to Rise Among Younger Women, Study Finds
description: Death rates are declining among U.S. women with breast cancer. But the disease is turning up more often in women under age 50.

title: Rwanda’s Doctors and Nurses Hit Hard by Deadly Marburg Virus
description: The Health Ministry has reported that 80 percent of the infected are health care professionals.

title: ‘Mom, I Want to Live’: A Young Girl Battles War and Cancer
description: Sonya Liakh was diagnosed with eye cancer at age 2. After Russia’s invasion of Ukraine disrupted her treatment, her family faced a desperate struggle.

title: Nighttime Depression Is a Real Thing
description: There are lots of reasons your mood might tank at night. Here’s how to address the bedtime blues.

title: California Sues Hospital for Denying Patient an Emergency Abortion
description: The state said that despite a doctor’s recommendation and state law, a Catholic hospital declined to provide an abortion because fetal heart tones were present.

title: Rabies Death in Minnesota Linked to Exposure to Bat, Officials Say
description: The death, which was reported on Friday, is only the fifth fatal human rabies case in Minnesota since 1975, health officials said.

title: After Your Death, Who Takes Care of the Dog?
description: A pet trust designates a new guardian for companion animals and sets aside funds for their care. Better yet, it’s legally binding.

title: Viewfinders Make Fall Foliage Pop for the Colorblind in Virginia
description: Specialized viewfinders installed across state parks let visitors with red-green colorblindness see more distinct colors.

title: Biden Officials Stave Off Sticker Shock on Medicare Drug Premiums
description: Federal regulators spent billions of dollars to avoid a spike in costs for older Americans that could have been politically damaging to the presidential campaign of Vice President Kamala Harris.

title: Possible Cluster of Human Bird-Flu Infections Expands in Missouri
description: Seven people in contact with a patient hospitalized with bird flu also developed symptoms, the C.D.C. reported. Some are undergoing further tests.

title: Acadia Healthcare Says It Faces New Federal Investigations
description: Shares of the company, one of the largest chains of for-profit psychiatric hospitals, were down 25 percent at one point.

title: Risk of Heart Defects Higher in Babies Conceived With I.V.F.
description: The birth defects were more likely, but still very uncommon, in infants conceived through certain fertility treatments, a large study found.

title: Convenience store giants fight Health Canada’s nicotine pouch rules
description: Convenience store firms across Canada are taking the federal government to court to overturn regulations that restrict the sale of nicotine pouches to pharmacies.

title: Invisible killer: What is antimicrobial resistance?

Everyone seems to have had a family member or friend who has either gotten seriously ill or died due to acquiring an infection that did not respond to prescribed medicines, and the underlying reason was often antimicrobial resistance. Yet, there are many ways of addressing this threat, from hygiene and sanitation to vaccination and avoiding overuse or misuse of medicines.

It provides insights on their protein content and offers practical tips on incorporating them into various meals for optimal protein intake.

title: How Sarojini Nagar became a go-to shopping spot
description: A paradise for bargain and shopping hunters with top-notch brands and statement trendy pieces.

title: How to grow papaya in a pot in the balcony
description: ​Papaya mostly grows in tropical lands and fairly becomes a large tree. It is one of the healthiest fruits and can be grown in a pot with proper care.​

title: Five things to keep in your home to maintain peace and love
description: Creating an environment of peace and love within your home requires more than just decor- it’s about bringing in elements that nurture positive energy and foster a sense of well-being. Incorporating items like a Buddha statue, mirrors, money plants, clear crystal stones, and wind chimes will make it serenely harmonious. These beautiful items will not only enhance your space but also create a peaceful and loving atmosphere, just as you desire.

title: IITian works as a cab driver in the US
description: During his US trip, comedian Vir Das had a poignant encounter with an Indian cab driver in San Jose. The driver, a former scientist with a PhD and IIT degree, resorted to driving a cab after losing his job. He shared his bittersweet experience of striving for a better future while grappling with the challenges of living abroad.

title: 10 quotes on success and failure every kid should know
description: Success and failure are the two sides of the same coin and these quotes teach valuable lessons about resilience, determination, and the importance of pursuing dreams despite challenges.

title: Most Nikah-worthy green ensembles
description: Let's take a look at some Nikah-worthy green ensembles for soon-to-be brides.

title: Hidden dangers of Vitamin D deficiency in women
description: Often dismissed as mere fatigue or aging, Vitamin D deficiency is a silent epidemic among women. Crucial for bone health, this deficiency can lead to osteoporosis, fractures, and persistent tiredness. The deficiency also impacts mental health, potentially causing mood swings and cognitive decline. Furthermore, it can disrupt hormonal balance, leading to menstrual irregularities and even infertility.

title: Nayanthara inspired stunning jewellery pieces
description: Let's take a look at some stunning jewellery pieces from Nayanthara's exqusite jewellery vanity.

title: Shalini Passi doesn't use any hair colour: Her secret
description: Shalini Passi, recognized for her elegance and beauty, revealed her natural hair care routine. She avoids chemical treatments and embraces natural ingredients, even oiling her hair with coconut oil before outings. Her holistic approach to wellness, including a nutrient-rich diet and detox practices, contributes to her radiant appearance.

title: How spending 1hr in park can improve your health​
description: ​Spending just one hour in a park each day offers numerous health benefits. Whether you're walking, relaxing, or engaging in social activities, the park provides a natural setting to improve your physical, mental, and emotional well-being. From reducing stress and boosting your mood to enhancing creativity and strengthening your immune system, time spent outdoors is an easy, enjoyable, and powerful way to improve your overall health. So, next time you're feeling overwhelmed or tired, step outside and take a break in the park—you might be surprised at how much it improves your health! ​

title: 10 cutest puppies that will warm your heart
description: From Golden Retriever to Corgi Puppy, here are 10 cutest puppies that will warm your heart and brighten your day.

title: Best Mehendi designs for modern brides
description: Here are some trending mehendi designs for minimal brides.

title: 5 best Pakistani blouse designs
description: Let's take a quick look at some stunning Pakistani blouse designs for this wedding season.

title: Revealed: When humans, mammals will be extinct
description: A new study predicts a grim future for humanity as Earth's continents drift towards forming a supercontinent. This will lead to extreme temperatures, reaching 40-50°C, making survival impossible for humans and many other species due to the inability to regulate body heat.

title: Dr Reddy's, FDC recall products in US for manufacturing issues
description: Dr Reddy's Laboratories and FDC Ltd issued voluntary recalls for medications in the US market due to manufacturing defects. Dr Reddy's recalled lots of Morphine Sulfate extended-release tablets due to failed impurity specifications, while FDC Ltd recalled Timolol Maleate ophthalmic solution due to defective containers hindering solution dispensing.

title: Menopause is hot: How celebrities and startups are transforming women's health
description: Menopause is having a moment, with celebrities and entrepreneurs capitalising on the growing global market for menopause-related products and services.  Indian women are also seeking solutions, leading to a surge in femtech startups offering everything from supplements and digital platforms to community support, aiming to break the taboo surrounding menopause.

title: Telangana secures over Rs 36,000 crore in life sciences investments, genome valley leads the way
description: Telangana's Genome Valley is attracting substantial investments in life sciences. Over Rs. 36,000 crore was invested in the past year. This resulted in over 140 new projects. These projects include pharmaceutical manufacturing, R&D centers, and vaccine production. International companies are partnering with Indian businesses. The government expects these investments to create thousands of jobs.

title: India's healthcare expenditure less than 2% of GDP, needs to be increased: C Rangarajan
description: Former Reserve Bank governor C Rangarajan emphasized the urgent need for India to increase its healthcare expenditure, currently below 2% of GDP. He advocated for efficient fund utilization, establishment of hospitals with free services, and a balanced approach to social spending, prioritizing both healthcare and education.

title: 6 health benefits of drinking black coffee without sugar every day
description: Black coffee is a simple, calorie-free beverage with numerous health advantages. By skipping sugar, it becomes a powerhouse of nutrients and compounds that promote overall wellness. Here are six key benefits of drinking black coffee without sugar:

title: Diabetes too serious to be left to medical professionals only: Jitendra Singh
description: India is tackling its diabetes epidemic head-on. At the 52nd Annual Conference of the Research Society for the Study of Diabetes in India, experts stressed the need for public-private partnerships to address the disease affecting over 10 crore Indians.

title: Lubrizol, Polyhose to set up manufacturing facility in Tamil Nadu to make medical tubing
description: Lubrizol, a Berkshire Hathaway company, is partnering with Polyhose to establish a medical tubing manufacturing plant in Tamil Nadu, India.  The facility, slated to begin operations in 2026, will significantly increase Lubrizol's production capacity, aiming to serve both domestic and international markets with high-quality medical tubing for various applications.

title: Understanding weight-related risks in type 2 diabetes
description: India is witnessing a surge in diabetes, with type 2 diabetes (T2D) being the most prevalent.  Unhealthy diets and inactivity are significant contributors to T2D, leading to obesity and increasing the risk of complications like insulin resistance, cardiovascular disease, and sleep apnea.  Managing weight through a balanced diet and exercise is crucial for mitigating these risks.

title: 7 surprising ways to use tea beyond drinking you didn't know about
description: Discover 7 surprising ways to use tea beyond just drinking! From reducing puffy eyes and fighting dandruff to deodorizing your home and repelling pests, these creative tea hacks will transform your routine.

title: Want to add beetroot to your diet? Here are 7 healthy & colorful recipes for every meal
description: Beetroot is a nutrient-packed vegetable known for its rich color and health benefits. Here are seven delicious and healthy beetroot recipes to enjoy throughout the day.

title: World Diabetes Day 2024: 8 common myths debunked
description: Discover the truth behind 8 common diabetes myths, from misconceptions about sugar consumption to fertility concerns. Learn how to manage the condition and separate fact from fiction for better health.

title: India has the highest number of diabetic people in the world, even more than China: Report
description: A new study reveals that over 800 million adults worldwide have diabetes. India leads the world with 212 million cases, followed by China with 148 million. The US has 42 million cases. The global diabetes rate has doubled since 1990. The study used data from over 140 million people across more than 1,000 studies.

title: US-based AptarGroup breaks ground for new pharma plant in Taloja, near Mumbai
description: AptarGroup held a groundbreaking ceremony for a new pharmaceutical plant in Taloja, India. The facility expands AptarGroup's presence in the region. The plant will produce pressurized metered dose inhaler valves, breath-actuated devices, and single-dose nasal sprays.  The company is exploring acquisitions to expand its drug delivery offerings.

title: Pharma market sees 6.1% growth in October despite subdued volumes
description: Amongst the top 10 therapies that contribute to more than 90% of the Indian pharma market, price drove growth in the cardiac segment. The anti-hypertensives, which account for almost 50% of the cardiac segment, is experiencing stagnated volume growth. Lipid-lowering drugs and platelet aggregation inhibitors have shown a relatively higher growth to help boost the cardiac segment.

title: Neem or curry leaves for healthier hair: Which works better?
description: Neem and curry leaves are popular natural ingredients for hair care, each offering unique benefits. Neem is known for its powerful antifungal and antibacterial properties, while curry leaves are rich in nutrients that strengthen and promote hair growth. Here’s a comparison to help you decide which might be better for your hair needs.

title: Diabetes and heart health: Acting early
description: Type 2 diabetes significantly elevates the risk of heart disease, making individuals more susceptible to heart attacks, strokes, and heart failure.  Early management is crucial, focusing on blood sugar control, blood pressure and cholesterol management, weight loss, and lifestyle modifications.  This proactive approach can provide long-term heart health benefits, known as the "legacy effect."

title: Alembic Pharmaceuticals gets USFDA nod for generic hypertension treatment capsules
description: Alembic Pharmaceuticals Ltd has secured final approval from the USFDA for its generic Diltiazem Hydrochloride extended-release capsules. These capsules, available in strengths of 120 mg to 360 mg, are designed to treat hypertension and manage angina. This approval grants Alembic access to an estimated market valued at USD 105.3 million annually.

title: TA Associates to acquire majority stake in Vee Healthtek for $250 m
description: US private equity firm TA Associates is set to acquire a majority stake in Vee Healthtek, an Indian revenue cycle management firm, for $250 million. The deal marks TA's entry into India's RCM market and its second investment in the country's healthcare IT sector.

title: Winter superfoods: 8 dry fruits and seeds to eat, their benefits, and ideal portions
description: Discover 8 dry fruits and seeds to boost your health this winter. Learn their benefits and the ideal servings for enhanced immunity, energy, and overall well-being.

title: Medical devices industry welcomes government's Rs 500-crore scheme
description: India's medical device industry is celebrating a new ₹500 crore government scheme designed to boost domestic manufacturing and reduce reliance on imports.  The scheme will fund key initiatives such as manufacturing essential components, developing shared infrastructure, and supporting clinical studies, ultimately aiming to position India as a global leader in medical technology.

title: Hashimoto's disease explained: Arjun Kapoor's battle, symptoms, and risks
description: Arjun Kapoor opens up about his struggle with Hashimoto’s disease, an autoimmune disorder affecting the thyroid. This slideshow explores the symptoms, risk factors, and what the condition entails for Kapoor.

title: Which weight loss method is most effective: Fasting, early eating, or fewer meals?
description: This research compares three popular weight-loss methods: intermittent fasting, eating earlier in the day, and consuming fewer meals. All methods show similar results, so choose the one that fits your lifestyle.

title: Labour Ministry enters into MoU with Cygnus Ujala to enhance employability in the healthcare sector
description: The Ministry of Labour and Employment has partnered with Cygnus Ujala to boost healthcare job opportunities on the National Career Service (NCS) portal. This collaboration aims to add 25 lakh vacancies, focusing on Tier II and Tier III cities, with an emphasis on women's employment.

title: NPPA asks companies to cut prices of three cancer drugs post tax relief
description: In a move aimed at providing relief to cancer patients, the National Pharmaceutical Pricing Authority (NPPA) has directed drug manufacturers to reduce the maximum retail price (MRP) of three crucial cancer drugs. This directive follows the government's decision to exempt Trastuzumab Deruxtecan, Osimertinib, and Durvalumab from Customs duty and reduce GST rates on these medications.

title: Medanta enters O&M for 750 bed super specialty hospital in New Delhi; to invest Rs 600 crore
description: Global Health, the company behind Medanta hospitals, has partnered with Dr. Narayan Dutt Shirmali Foundation to manage a new 750-bed super specialty hospital in Pitampura, New Delhi.  The hospital, expected to open in four years, represents a Rs. 600 crore investment for Medanta and will offer a wide range of specialized medical services.

title: OmniActive Health acquires botanical ingredients company ENovate Biolife
description: OmniActive Health Technologies, a Mumbai-based nutraceutical company, has acquired ENovate Biolife, a developer of botanical ingredients. This acquisition, funded through internal accruals, marks OmniActive's second strategic expansion.  OmniActive aims to double its revenue to ₹2,000 crores within the next 5 to 6 years.

title: Health groups raise concerns over patents for rare disease drugs
description: Health groups and patient advocates are raising concerns over patent monopolies on rare disease drugs in India. They argue that these monopolies, like the one held by Roche for the spinal muscular atrophy drug Risdiplam, restrict access to affordable medication.

title: Government strengthening India’s primary healthcare system: VK Paul
description: Speaking at the healthcare event, Ficci Heal 2024, organised by the Federation of Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industry on Tuesday, NITI Aayog member VK Paul said the government is building the entire primary healthcare system which will be future ready and will serve our nation’s journey to Viksit Bharat by 2047.

title: Venus Remedies gets GMP approval for pre-filled syringe facility
description: Indian pharmaceutical company Venus Remedies received a significant approval from the Malaysian authorities. The company's Baddi facility, equipped with advanced robotic technology, met the stringent quality standards for producing pre-filled syringes. This recognition paves the way for Venus Remedies to expand its global presence and provide critical medications to more countries.

title: CDSCO may regulate health supplements to stem unapproved claims by firms
description: A government panel in India is proposing stricter regulations on health claims made by supplement manufacturers.  The panel suggests shifting control from the food safety authority to the drug regulator, aiming to curb exaggerated claims related to disease treatment or risk reduction.

title: US firm Alkomex to expand R&D footprint in India
description: Global pharmaceutical company Alkomex GBN is expanding its research and development operations into India. The company has appointed nutraceuticals expert Dr. Sanjay Agrawal as Scientific Advisor to lead these efforts. Based in Ahmedabad, Dr. Agrawal will oversee research and strategic initiatives, integrating Indian research into Alkomex's global operations.

title: FSSAI sets stricter rule for antibiotics in food items
description: "If enforced strictly, the regulations will ensure safer food products for consumers by setting stricter residue and contaminant limits across a variety of food items and help in dealing with antimicrobial resistance," said George Cheriyan, working president of Consumers Protection Association (CPA). The FSSAI has also prohibited the use of antibiotics during honey production and reset the limit of the chemicals ochratoxin A and deoxynivalenol in wheat, wheat bran, barley, rye and coffee.

title: Bajra roti or wheat roti? Which is better for health and weight loss?
description: Choosing bajra roti over wheat can be a great step toward better health and well-being. Here are the key benefits of choosing bajra roti over wheat for a healthier lifestyle.

title: Dr Reddy's recalls over 3.3 lakh bottles of generic medication in US: USFDA
description: Dr Reddy's Laboratories is recalling over 3.3 lakh bottles of Cinacalcet tablets in the US due to manufacturing issues. The recall is due to the presence of an impurity above FDA limits. The recall affects 30 mg, 60 mg, and 90 mg strengths, with the affected lot produced in India. The recall was initiated on October 9, 2023.

title: Apollo Hospitals announces Rs 1,625 crore expansion in Mumbai and Lucknow
description: Apollo Hospitals announces a major expansion plan in Mumbai and Lucknow with a total investment of Rs 1625 crore over the next four years. The expansion, involving a 500-bed facility in Worli and a 200-bed extension in Lucknow, will be funded through internal accruals and debt financing.

title: From fish to seeds: 5 excellent sources of Omega-3 fats for a healthier diet
description: Omega-3 fatty acids are essential fats that play a crucial role in maintaining heart health, supporting brain function, and reducing inflammation. While fatty fish are well-known sources, there are several other foods you can include in your diet to ensure you’re getting enough omega-3s. Here are five excellent sources to consider:

title: Suven, Cohance aim to double combined business revenue to Rs 6,000 cr by FY29
description: Suven Pharmaceuticals and Cohance Lifesciences plan to merge and aim to double their revenue to Rs 6,000 crore by FY29 through organic and inorganic growth. The merger has received NSE and BSE approvals, with a shareholders meeting scheduled for November 28, 2024. The combined entity will focus on pharma CDMO, specialty chemicals CDMO, and APIs.

title: Govt to recast Insacog as Covid cases decline
description: The Indian government is considering restructuring Insacog, the consortium monitoring genomic variations in SARS-CoV-2, due to the decline in new Covid-19 cases and reduced testing frequency. Experts aim to determine whether to continue extensive sequencing or streamline it to fewer laboratories based on current needs.

title: Yatharth Hospital to acquire 60% stake in Faridabad-based facility
description: Yatharth Hospital and Trauma Care Services has greenlit the acquisition of a 60% stake in a yet-to-be-operational 400-bed hospital in Faridabad valued at Rs 152 crore. This move, alongside acquiring a super speciality hospital in Model Town, Delhi, aims to bolster its presence in the Delhi-NCR region.

title: SumeetSSG to invest Rs 1,600 cr in Maharashtra; bags emergency medical service project
description: Medical emergency service provider SumeetSSG will invest Rs 1,600 crore in Maharashtra to implement the MEMS 108 Ambulance Project, introducing advanced ambulance fleets with specialised medical equipment. The ten-year project, valued at Rs 14,000 crore, aims to enhance healthcare infrastructure and emergency response services across the state.

title: Biocon Biologics' Bengaluru unit classified as voluntary action indicated by USFDA
description: Biocon Biologics' drug substance facility in Bengaluru has been classified by the USFDA as voluntary action indicated after a cGMP inspection conducted in February 2024. The classification means that while some objections were noted, no regulatory action is recommended. The facility is responsible for supplying rh-Insulin drug substance to the US.

title: National Company Law Tribunal clears Casper Pharma’s merger with Suven Pharmaceuticals
description: The NCLT Mumbai has approved the merger of Casper Pharma with Suven Pharmaceuticals. This merger aims to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and streamline operations. The amalgamation will utilize combined resources, reduce duplication of work, and integrate management. This is a significant step towards a more efficient corporate structure in the pharmaceutical industry.

title: Fortis Healthcare gets CCI nod to acquire additional stake in Agilus Diagnostics for Rs 1,780 cr
description: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has approved Fortis Healthcare's acquisition of an additional 31.52% stake in Agilus Diagnostics, raising its total share to 89.2%. Additionally, CCI has greenlit the merger of Diliigent Power into DB Power and the reorganisation of Decore Thermal Power.

title: Lyfius Pharma Penicillin-G plant inaugurated by PM Modi
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi virtually inaugurated Lyfius Pharma's Penicillin-G plant in Kakinada, Andhra Pradesh, with a production capacity of 15,000 MT. The Rs 2,500 crore investment under the PLI Scheme aims to boost domestic manufacturing, reduce import dependency, and support 'Atmanirbhar Bharat' in establishing India as a global pharmaceutical hub.

title: Govt asks manufacturers to cut price of 3 anti-cancer drugs
description: The government has directed manufacturers to lower prices of Trastuzumab, Osimertinib, and Durvalumab after exempting them from customs duty and reducing GST. This measure aims to ensure affordable anti-cancer drugs for consumers. Companies must update and report new prices to authorities and dealers.

title: PM Modi to launch, inaugurate multiple health sector projects worth over Rs 12,850 cr today
description: On the occasion of Dhanvantari Jayanti and 9th Ayurveda Day, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will launch, inaugurate and lay the foundation stone of multiple projects related to the health sector worth around Rs 12,850 crore on Tuesday at the All India Institute of Ayurveda (AIIA) in the national capital.

title: Dr Reddy's launches medication to treat chronic constipation
description: Dr Reddy's Laboratories has launched BixiBat, a new drug for chronic constipation in India. It is the first company to receive approval from the CDSCO for Elobixibat. The drug works by increasing bile acid concentration in the colon, promoting bowel movements. Clinical studies showed promising results. Shares of the company went up by 0.84 percent.

title: NCIL developing indigenous dialysis machine in collaboration with NIT Silchar
description: Nephro Care India Limited, in collaboration with NIT, Silchar, is developing an AI-enabled smart haemodialysis machine with a grant from West Bengal's Department of Science and Technology. This prototype aims to slash costs by up to 75%, making renal care more affordable and accessible, especially in rural areas.

title: Could a Rs 72 lakh drug cost just Rs 3,000? A 24-year-old's courtroom revelation
description: A 24-year-old SMA patient in Kerala High Court revealed that Risdiplam, a crucial SMA drug, could be locally produced for Rs 3,000 annually compared to the current Rs 72 lakh. Highlighting the need for local manufacturing, the petition challenges the sufficiency of the Indian Health Ministry's financial aid and crowdfunding efforts.

title: Piramal Pharma deploying USD 85 mn capex this fiscal: Nandini Piramal
description: Piramal Pharma is investing USD 85 million this fiscal for initiatives like capacity expansion and maintenance. They have already used USD 30 million in the first half. Part of the funds will be for domestic use and some for the US. The company aims to reach USD 2 billion in revenue by FY30.

title: ChatGPT Defeated Doctors at Diagnosing Illness
description: A small study found ChatGPT outdid human physicians when assessing medical case histories, even when those doctors were using a chatbot.

title: First U.S. Case of Spreading New Mpox Type Reported in California
description: The unidentified patient had recently returned from Africa, where the virus has caused a deadly epidemic, health officials said.

title: RFK Jr.'s Vow to Take On Big Food Could Face Resistance
description: Processed foods are in the cross hairs of Robert F. Kennedy Jr., but battling major companies could collide with President-elect Donald J. Trump’s corporate-friendly goals.

title: Why Kennedy Sees an ‘Epidemic’ of Chronic Disease Among Children
description: Trends in child health are in fact worrisome, and scientists welcome a renewed focus on foods and environmental toxins. But vaccines and fluoride are not the cause.

title: Kennedy’s Views Mix Mistrust of Business With Unfounded Health Claims
description: President-elect Donald J. Trump’s pick for health secretary opposes fluoride in water, promotes unproven Covid therapies and has threatened to prosecute medical journals.

title: The Anti-Fluoride Movement Vaults Into the Mainstream
description: With the nomination of Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as health secretary, a formerly fringe opinion suddenly gets wide attention.

title: Americans Have Regained Modest Trust in Scientists, Survey Finds
description: A sharp partisan divide remains over how involved researchers should be in policy decisions.

title: Canadian Teenager Is Country’s First Human Bird Flu Case
description: A teenager in British Columbia was hospitalized in critical condition with the disease, and officials were working to find out how the person was exposed to the virus.

title: US Regulators Seek to Block UnitedHealth’s $3.3 Billion Purchase of Home Care Company
description: The Justice Department and four Democratic state attorneys general argued that United’s takeover would limit competition and harm consumers needing home or hospice care.

title: 1 Dead and Dozens Ill in E. Coli Outbreak Linked to Organic Carrots
description: The outbreak, which has sickened nearly 40 people, has been tied to multiple brands of recalled organic carrots sold by Grimmway Farms, officials said.

title: NASA Says Astronaut Suni Williams Is in ‘Incredible Health’
description: The agency’s top medical official was responding to rumors that Suni Williams had lost an unusual amount of weight during an extended stay in orbit.

title: A.D.H.D. Symptoms Are Milder With a Busy Schedule, Study Finds
description: New research suggests symptoms of the disorder may be less severe in those with a demanding schedule.

title: At Long Last, the Surge in S.T.I.s May Be Leveling Off
description: Rates of gonorrhea declined in 2023, while diagnoses of syphilis and chlamydia held roughly steady, according to new C.D.C. data.

title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s FDA Wish List: Raw Milk, Stem Cells, Heavy Metals
description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., one of President-elect Donald J. Trump’s advisers on health, is taking aim at the agency’s oversight on many fronts.

title: As the Pandemic Deepened, Americans Kept Drinking More
description: Excessive drinking persisted in the years after Covid arrived, according to new data.

title: 25 Escaped Monkeys of 43 Are Captured in South Carolina
description: The monkeys escaped after a worker at a research center left an enclosure unlocked. One monkey was captured Saturday, and another 24 on Sunday, while the rest remain at large.

title: For Older Unmarried Couples, Caregiving Obligations Can Be Murky
description: What should be expected of an intimate partner when a companion suffers a health crisis? Seniors and their families increasingly confront the question.

title: Voters in Red and Blue States Repudiate Lenient Drug Policies
description: Californians voted for tougher penalties for dealers. Florida, North Dakota and South Dakota rejected proposals to legalize marijuana. Massachusetts denied a measure allowing possession of psychedelics.

title: Richard Pazdur, FDA Cancer Chief, Discusses 25 Years of Innovation
description: Dr. Richard Pazdur for 25 years has overseen innovations in the treatment of deadly diseases at the agency.

title: A Door Is Unlocked, and 43 Monkeys Make a Bid for Freedom
description: Dozens of rhesus macaques escaped a research facility in South Carolina. They’re still on the lam.

title: B.C. animal clinics told to set up avian flu protocols amid human exposure risk
description: B.C. health authorities have announced the first case of a human avian flu infection acquired in Canada, with the teenage patient in critical condition in hospital.

title: Bird flu in Canada: What to know about poultry and milk safety
description: People have been hearing a lot about H5N1 bird flu — or highly pathogenic avian influenza — since a B.C. teen became the first human to get the virus in Canada and is in hospital.

title: Expert panel announced for creation of national pharmacare program
description: The Liberal government and the NDP negotiated the substance of a pharmacare bill as part of their now-defunct supply-and-confidence agreement.

title: Trump names RFK Jr., anti-vaccine activist, as U.S. health secretary
description: Kennedy ran as an independent presidential candidate but gave Trump his endorsement with a promise to have a role in health policy in the next Trump administration.

title: Taylor Swift is here, along with fall viruses. How to stay ‘safe and sound’
description: As Taylor Swift's show kicks off in Toronto, health experts warn that large crowds and public transit could increase the spread of respiratory illnesses like the flu.

title: As Canada’s diabetes rates stabilize, experts say it’s not all good news
description: As global diabetes rates rise, prevalence of the disease in Canada has stabilized in recent years, with women seeing the most progress, new research suggests.

title: Mould — yes, mould — spurs recall of Hallmark Star Wars Christmas ornament
description: The Hallmark Keepsake ornament featuring Cad Bane from 'The Book of Boba Fett' is being recalled due to reports of mould found on its surface.

title: Global measles cases jumped 20% in 2023 due to ‘inadequate’ vaccine use
description: The world saw a 20 per cent jump in measles cases in 2023, driven by a lack of vaccine coverage in the poorest countries and those riddled by conflict.

title: The FDA wants these cold medicines off the shelves. Should Canada follow?
description: The FDA has proposed removing phenylephrine, a common ingredient in decongestants, due to its ineffectiveness, which may prompt Canada to review its approval of the drug.

title: As bird flu emerges in Canada, experts urge preparedness
description: There are no indications that H5N1 bird flu would spark a pandemic, but experts urged preparedness including stockpiling vaccines and using wastewater testing.

title: Jeddah conference closes with adoption of global pledges to tackle antimicrobial resistance
description: The 4th Global High-Level Ministerial Conference on Antimicrobial Resistance (AMR) wrapped up on Saturday with the adoption of the Jeddah Commitments, which lay out practical, actionable and cross-sectoral steps stakeholders can take to address this complex health issue.

title: Antimicrobial resistance crisis ‘happening now,’ WHO’s Tedros stresses at Jeddah summit
description: The top UN health official gave a sobering reality check as the Fourth Global High-Level Ministerial Meeting on Antimicrobial Resistance began Friday in Jeddah: “AMR doesn't just threaten to make the medicines on which we depend less effective; it’s happening now.”

title: World News in Brief: Haiti crisis, measles surge, global torture accord turns 40
description: Insecurity and overlapping crises afflicting Haiti are continuing to fuel a dire humanitarian situation across the Caribbean nation, the UN Spokesperson said on Thursday.

title: From Declaration to action: Antimicrobial resistance initiatives centre stage at Jeddah conference
description: Antimicrobial resistance initiatives are back in the spotlight as stakeholders gather in Jeddah, on the Saudi Arabian coast, a few months after a high-level meeting in New York led to the unanimous adoption of a political declaration by the UN General Assembly. With that declaration the 193-member body pledged concerted action against the under-recognized but serious health concern.

title: Global diabetes epidemic reaches critical levels with 800 million cases
description: Global diabetes cases have quadrupled since 1990, affecting over 800 million adults worldwide, according to a World Health Organization (WHO) study released to coincide with World Diabetes Day.

title: Adolescents face mounting pressure at school, decline in family support
description: Adolescents across Europe, Central Asia and Canada say they face rising school pressure and diminishing support from families and friends, according to a new report from the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Health Behaviour in School-aged Children (HBSC) survey.

title: WHO ‘working tirelessly’ to help save lives as Middle East crisis grinds on
description: Amid the ongoing turmoil in the Middle East, the World Health Organization (WHO) continues efforts to keep hospitals up and running and to evacuate patients requiring specialized treatment, a senior official with the UN agency said in Cairo on Monday.

title: Cyberattacks on healthcare: A global threat that can’t be ignored
description: An alarming surge in ransomware attacks is putting the world’s healthcare infrastructure at critical risk, endangering patient safety and destabilising health systems, the head of the UN World Health Organization (WHO) warned on Friday, as the Security Council convened to discuss strategies to counter the growing threat.

title: Sudan launches first malaria vaccine in landmark child health initiative
description: In a historic health milestone, Sudan has launched its first malaria vaccination campaign amid 18 months of civil conflict, aiming to protect thousands of children from the deadly disease.

title: WHO identifies 17 pathogens as top priorities for new vaccine development
description: A new study by the World Health Organization (WHO) lists 17 bacteria, viruses and parasites that regularly cause disease as top priorities for new vaccine development.

title: Gaza: Polio campaign reaches 94,000 children in besieged north
description: The UN-supported polio vaccine campaign concluded in besieged northern Gaza on Monday, with agencies inoculating 94,000 children, but thousands still remain out of reach.

title: Gaza: Strike hits health centre as polio vaccine campaign resumes in ravaged north
description: The long-awaited final phase of a UN-supported polio vaccine campaign began on Saturday in bombarded, besieged northern Gaza even as reports emerged that one vaccination centre had been hit during a humanitarian pause, according to UN agencies on the ground.

title: WHO concerned following raid on North Gaza hospital
description: Reports of Israeli troops storming one of the last functioning hospitals in northern Gaza are deeply concerning, while ongoing hostilities are hampering polio vaccination in the area, the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Friday.

title: Gaza: Palestinians are dying amid lethal evacuation delays
description: Children and disabled people are facing ever more horrific conditions in war-torn Gaza, with some dying as they wait for medical evacuations, as the year-long war grinds on, UN officials and rights experts said on Friday.

title: UNICEF: 85 per cent of children affected by polio in 2023 lived in fragile, conflict-affected areas
description: Countries facing conflict, natural disasters and humanitarian crises are struggling to provide routine childhood immunisations leaving many children vulnerable to the resurgence of polio, the UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF) warned in new report.

title: Gaza: Israeli strikes delay polio vaccine campaign in the north
description: Intense bombardments, mass displacements and lack of access in northern Gaza have forced the postponement of a polio vaccination campaign, the World Health Organization (WHO) warned on Wednesday.
